page.title: 01Farmland in Cumbria
page.content: The block, which is 125 - 175 metres above sealevel, consists largely of farmland divided into small fields. There are patches of deciduous woodland, especially along the rivers and streams, which have carved out steep little valleys. There are only about 50 dwellings on the whole block, farms and cottages scattered across the area and one tiny hamlet, Churchtown. Services are minimal, the nearest Doctors' surgery is 5 miles away. There is no public transport at all. Three travelling shops and a mobile library visit the area and there is a Post Office at Churchtown and a pub at Sour Nook, The Royal Oak. There are many neglected areas of rough woodland and wide roadside verges where plants and wildlife flourish.
